column13: Steadfast's Summer Intern Program also offers six roles to school leavers each year. We are delighted with the quality of people who have joined us and stayed through these programs.

Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column8: Steadfast's DE&I Strategy and its Diversity Policy
column13: Steadfast's DE&I Strategy and Diversity Policy focus on gender, LGBTQIA+ and disability. By surveying our people, we established that they are passionate about these areas, which helped shape the framework of our DE&I.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Steadfast again joined Hollard Insurance in 2023 to help develop the next Group of female leaders via the Aspire Women Leaders Program. The Aspire Women Leaders Program is a year-long development program specifically tailored to Steadfast female insurance intermediaries looking to become future business leaders. Although improving, there are still steps to be taken to ensure that women are at least equally represented and valued in management and executive positions in our industry. We have demonstrated our commitment to our female brokers and offer a dedicated leadership program.

column7: Steadfast complies with relevant laws, community expectations, and ethical standards related to human rights and modern slavery regarding our employees and business. Employees are encouraged to report genuine concerns about modern slavery relating to our people, business, or supply chain.

column7: We reject any form of modern slavery, such as servitude, human trafficking, forced labour and marriage, child labour and debt bondage. We are committed to promoting adherence to internationally recognised human rights principles, including the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGPs).

column7: Steadfast rejects any form of modern slavery, such as slavery, servitude, human trafficking and forced labour. We aim to identify and manage risks related to human rights across our business and supply chain.

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: As a leader in the environmental sector and in recognition of Landcare Australia's success in improving biodiversity, building resilience in Australia's food and farming systems, and creating stronger communities, Steadfast continued its support of Landcare this year.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Steadfast's volunteer day program encourages our employees to volunteer at a registered charity. All employees can receive a day of paid employment to volunteer. Steadfast employees donated 270 volunteer hours this year, reflecting an 8% participation rate.\t

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Underwriting Agencies of Australia (UAA), a Steady business, has been instrumental in building a unique and critically important Indigenous Talent ID Program (ITID) for indigenous athletes offered by the Regional Academies of Sport (RAS) across regional NSW. Annually, the RAS network identifies close to 1,000 talented indigenous athletes and provides approximately 140 fully funded scholarships into RAS sporting programs. The ITID Program is now one of the largest talent identification programs available throughout the Regional Academy network.
column20: Indigenous Talent ID Program, Indigenous Relations, Engagement\t

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column7: The Steadfast Foundation portal is a workplace giving platform that enables Steadfast staff to participate and engage in the Foundation's mission. The portal lets all staff easily participate in regular workplace giving and make pre-tax salary donations. For every dollar donated by staff, Steadfast Group Ltd will match contributions dollar for dollar, capped at an annual total of $100,000.

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: Cultural Walking Tours in Sydney and Melbourne are offered to all employees to provide a deeper and meaningful understanding of Aboriginal cultures, histories, knowledge and rights through cultural learning. Over 90 staff have attended the tours, and we will continue this initiative in FY24.

column7: Steadfast has a formal due diligence process whereby research is conducted to identify, assess, mitigate, and monitor inherent risks before proceeding with new strategic partners, brokers, and businesses. The executive must approve the potential parties before onboarding.\t

column7: Steadfast manages counterparty/outsourcing risk through the following activities: a procurement process for selecting suppliers is performed by the relevant business unit; legal review of supplier contracts; and monitoring of supplier performance by the relevant business unit.

Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: During the year, we implemented comprehensive policies and procedures to uphold these principles, including developing a security strategy. A range of security process enhancements were undertaken at the Steadfast Head Office. We expanded our Security Operations Centre capabilities. We introduced additional cyber security controls to assess third-party risk in our supply chain and vendor assessment process.\t
column20: Cyber security, Data protection, Risk management

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Our approach to cyber security is constantly evolving in response to changes in the threat landscape so that we can maintain system availability and support ongoing business operations. Our dedicated technology teams focus on migration, implementation, continued development and support of our core platforms. We have a range of activities to continuously test and assess the resilience and sustainability of our platforms, including cyber awareness training, phishing simulation exercises, penetration tests, vulnerability and patch management, and risk assessments. Business continuity, disaster recovery and crisis management plans are in place and tested at least annually.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: We have introduced additional cyber security controls to assess third-party risk in our supply chain and vendor assessment process in response to an increase globally in cyber attacks resulting from vulnerabilities in third-party systems and applications.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column7: We strive to prevent unauthorised Access, data breaches, and other cyber threats by implementing robust security measures.
